group_works.title: Waves and beaches

results.title: Waves and beaches
results.creator_credit: Eric Harrison, Julia Spark and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Geography today: a search for order”.
Examines the relationship between waves and beaches on Spurn head on the north shore of the Humber Estuary. Simulated demonstrations, using time-lapse photography, show the effects of waves and sand in a wave tank. Discusses sediment movement and the effect of different amounts of wave energy on beaches. Simple field experiments examine the factors effecting the size and shape of a beach. Suitable for senior students due to technical language and complex concepts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Harrison, Julia Spark and Granada Television International

results.title: Aspects of Central Place
results.creator_credit: Eric Harrison, Julia Spark and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geography today: a search for order”.
This film uses the Cambridge area of the United Kingdom to discuss the applicability of Christaller’s central place theory in a modern context. Explains the forces that have given growth to the city of Cambridge and the functions of centres at different levels of the settlement hierarchy in Canmbridge. Suitable for Upper-Secondary students.

results.title: We did it!: Rockhampton and Mackay
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight, National Aboriginal Employment Development Committee and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On the job (A)”
Shows Aboriginal people at work in Rockhampton and Mackay, talking about how they got their jobs, what they like about them and giving tips for other job seekers. Includes an employment officer, a secretary, an apprentice picutre framer and a TAFE field officer.
Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: We did it!: Western Australia
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight, National Aboriginal Employment Development Committee and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On the job (A)”.
Shows Aboriginal people in Western Australia talking about how they got their jobs, what they like about them and giving tips for other job seekers. Includes a student enrolled nurse, a teacher’s aide, a beautician, a horticulturalist and a park ranger.
Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On the job (A)”.
Shows Aboriginal people in Victoria talking about how they got their jobs, what they like about them and giving tips for other job seekers. Includes an apprentice chef, an apprentice painter and decorator, an apprentice gardener and a library assistant.
Suitable fvor middle and upper secondary levels.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On the job (A)”.
Shows Aboriginal people at work in South Australia, talking about how they got their jobs, what they like about them and giving tips for other job seekers. Includes a fisheries officer, an apprentice diesel mechanic, a nurse, a carpenter and a teacher.
Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Women of Utopia
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On the job (A)”.
With jokes and good humour, the Aboriginal women of Utopia cattle station show how they make their beautiful and exotic batik fabrics. Some of the women featured are Emily Ngwarai, Gloria Pitjara, Rosie Kunoth and Myrtle Pitjara. Also shows gathering/hunting of food and the cooking of it. Suitable for upper secondary level.
